{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3492005,"name":"Kelly","username":"Revision0","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/revision0/{size}/232304_2.png","created_at":"2025-01-24T22:27:27.154Z","cooked":"

Hey there!

This was meant to be a part of FRCDesignLib, but the UI doesn‚Äôt (yet) support the new Onshape Configuration Visibility feature. The feature was extensively used for this model to pass all of the options for the different motors through in a way that wouldn‚Äôt be cluttered. Configurations for specific inputs won‚Äôt be visible unless you select that input, for example.

The biggest thing this was trying to achieve was a configurable VersaPlanetary model that is simplified enough where people can use it on their robots without it adding a ton of primitives (lag), but detailed and BOM-accurate enough where people can use it for assembly blueprints and ordering. I think I achieved those things.

Onshape Link

image1455√ó1084 103 KB

Stage selection visibility is configured by the ‚ÄúStages‚Äù configuration. I had to do this in order to make sure fasteners for the stages could be correctly configured.

It is fully BOM-accurate. You can find all parts that are used to make the assembly in the base assembly with part numbers and vendors set.

image1066√ó353 23.2 KB

Because the motors used are the same ones from FRCDesignLib and MKCAD, when using a flattened BOM table they should stack with the rest of the motors.

Though this probably won‚Äôt be in the FRCDesignLib app for a while until we get that functionality added, feel free to use the normal insert feature with this.

This is an incredibly valuable resource‚Äîthank you so much for creating it! We really appreciate the effort you‚Äôve put into making these, and they will be a perfect fit for our SDS mk1 modules that we plan on using on our robot this year. We‚Äôre excited to incorporate them into our project and are confident they‚Äôll make a big difference.
